newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar tightly mixed, shuns tender news.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar tightly mixed, shuns tender news.

text.p: London white sugar futures were reluctant to stir into life on Thursday with little activity expected despite the emergence of fresh physical news, traders said.
"There's a bit of buying around but it's quiet," said one trader, noting the Ascension Day holiday in Europe and the start of the Moslem New Year.

The bulk of the light volume in London came from a trade of the October/December spread at $2.00. At 1155 GMT nearby positions were tightly mixed, with August up 30 cents at $312.00 and October unchanged at $303.20.
Overall volume reached a light 403 lots.

Technical analysts placed critical support for August at $308.00 with resistance points at $315.00 and $317.50. London largely ignored news that Pakistan had scrapped its tender to buy 50,000 tonnes of crystal whites as this had already been rumoured in the market.
Traders said Iran's tender to buy another cargo of whites was not expected to result in a sale as Iran's domestic demand was thought to be well covered.
Tunisia has tendered to buy a cargo of raw sugar but results are not expected for some time on account of the Moslem holiday.
The Paris market is market is closed on Thursday.
